captions.text:
Screen Adaptation
Sergei Bondarchuk
Vasily Solovyov

Ilya Rostov - V.Stanitsin
Countess Rostova - K.Golovko

Prince Bolkonsky - A.Ktorov
Princess Maria - A.Shuranova

Nikolushka - A.Syomin
Helene - I.Skobtseva
Anatole - V.Lanovoy

Drubetskoy - E.Martsevich
Anna Sherer - A.Stepanova
Prince Vasily - B.Smirnov

On June 12, West European armies
crossed the Russian frontier,

That is, an event took place
defying human reason
Well, Papa and Mama, I tell you

you must let me join the army,
because I can't--

Here's a fine warrior!
Nonsense! You must study.

Obolensky's younger than I
and he's going.

Besides, I can't study now
when...

- ...the country's in danger.
- Be quiet, I tell you.

Why, your mother's milk
hasn't dried on your lips yet!

Take up the spear and shield
and arise to help us.

Put to shame and disgrace
those who wish us ill.

May your powerful angel
chase them...

Strike our enemies and put
them to flight.

How could they make commander
a man

who falls asleep at council
meetings,

To have a blind general.
A fine thing!

Our troops fight as never
before.

However, the fate of the army
and the country

is in the hands of a good
minister but a bad general.

Barclay is dilatory.
The whole army curses him.
and will soon be in Smolensk.

What do you think about it,
prince?
may move so near to us that...

I have said and still say:
the theater of war is Poland.

The enemy will never get
beyond the Niemen.

When the snow melts they'll
sink in the Polish swamps.

He writes the French
were beaten.

The prince says nothing
about it.

Every place seemed
unsatisfactory to him.

But worst of all was
his couch in the study.

He dreaded it
because of the sad thoughts

that had come to him
when lying there.

The bolts? No, I told
him about them.

It was something... something
in the drawing-room.

What did he talk about
at dinner, Tikhon?
They will soon be in Smolensk.

- Heart?
- Yes, my heart is heavy.
I have been calling you all night.

If only I had known.
I was afraid to come.
I have a letter from him.
I want to try to sing now.

- It is something to do.
- Fine. I'm so happy.

Nikolai had received
a St.George's Cross.

I know. Well, I don't want
to interrupt you.
Is it wrong of me to sing?

No. Why should it be?
On the contrary.
But why do you ask me?

I don't know. I should not
like to do anything

I trust in you completely.
You mean so much to me.
You have done so much for me.

Will he ever forgive me?
What do you think?

Will he not always have
a bitter feeling against me?
I think he has nothing to forgive.
If I were in his place -

I know no one kinder and more
big-hearted

I don't know what would
become of me.

I forgot. I must be
getting home.

Have you heard? Kutuzov has
been made Field Marshal.

That's the end of our
differences.

I am delighted. At last!
There's a man for you!

Have no fear, he sees
all he ought to see.

Kutuzov is one of the cleverest
men I've ever known.

To do nothing but retreat,
with men like these?

I sent for you because
I need you near me.

but I'm afraid I won't do
for the staff.

I'm used to my regiment and
have grown fond of the men.

And I fancy they've grown
fond of me.
I would hate to leave them.

I've declined the honor of
being with you, but--
I'm sorry. I do need you.

We ought not to transfer
our best men to the staff.

I remember you with
the standard.
There were always plenty of them

Everybody is in too great
a hurry.
It is easy to take a fortress
but hard to win a campaign.

Kamensky used soldiers to
take Rushchuk.

and took more fortresses
than he did.

I made the Turks eat
horse-flesh.
and the French shall eat it too.

Thay shall, you can depend
on it!

But shan't we have
to engage in a battle?
We shall, if everybody wants it.
God bless you. Go your way.
It is an honorable way, I know.

Remember I share in your grief,
the loss of your father.

And for you I am not a prince
or a commander-in-chief,
Will they set us down here

- ...or take us to Moscow?
- Those fops!

The whole of the nation
is fighting.
It's a fight to the end.

What are you doing here,
Your Excellency?

I wanted to see what was
going on.

There will certainly
be something to see.

Heavy losses; we surrendered
the hill.

I too intend to take part
in the fighting.

Our position? That is not
my speciality.

You will see everything
from the hill.

but I must report the corps
commander.
There will be a battle tomorrow.

We expect not less than 20,000
wounded for every 100,000 men.

And we have no stretchers,
nor medical attendants,
He's out to scare the French!

Pierre was irresistibly drawn
to the battlefield
by an urge to sacrifice himself

and share in the general
suffering.

Allow me to ask what that
village is called.
Yes. And further on, the French.

- Where?
- Over there. In full view.

Yesterday we held it,
today it's theirs.
Who might you be, a doctor?

It's the icon of
the Mother of God.

The most blessed Mother of God,
save us.

Glory to the Father and
the Son and the Holy Spirit.

Now and forever and
in the ages of ages.
he had ever taken part in.

My country...
The fall of Moscow.

Why this trial, when tomorrow
I shall cease to be?
and I will cease to be.
I will cease to be. Forever.

the left flank of
the 2nd Battalion

I just came...
I wanted to see...

What is the news? Has my
family moved to Moscow?

Yes. I paid them a visit
but didn't find them in.

They are at yours
estate near Moscow.
I am not a military man,

that our left flank
is weak
and our right is too drawn out.

So you made sense of
the dislocation of our forces?

on positions, or weapons,
or even the number of men.

It depends on the feeling
within me, him,
Why did we lose at Austerlitz?

Positions? Nonsense.
That's not the point.
We had no right to fight there.

We wanted to leave
the battlefield.
are to meet in mortal combat.
is the side that will win.
Tomorrow we are certain to win,

The men won't even touch
their vodka.
Not on such a day, they say.
Do battle deep in the country.

"Deep in the country" is
my father, my son, my sister.

But what does he care about
that!

They gave up all of Europe
to Napoleon

and then came to teach us
wisdom.

So you think we will win
tomorrow's battle?
Yes, but if I had my way

The French destroyed my house
and mean to destroy Moscow.

They are my enemies.
They are criminals.

Timokhin thinks as I do.
The whole army too.

We must punish them. They
plunder and kill our children.

How can we talk about rules
of war and mercy to the foe?

We must take no prisoners but
kill and be prepared to die.

War is not a civility. It is
the lowest thing men stoop to.

One must realize this and
not make a game out of war.

Cast off the lies and see
war as war. It is no game.

Men come together like
they will tomorrow,

kill each other, maim
thousands upon thousands

for having killed
so many human beings
The side that kills the most

How can God bear to hear
and witness such things?

But... I don't have
to wait long...

However, we must both
get some sleep. Go now.

A good night's sleep is
a must before a battle.

I know that this is
our last meeting.

Be off with you, dear boy,
and God bless you.

One bit and your guts
are blown out.

It's our job, but why should
the gentleman be here?

So they want more?
Let them have it.

At the infantry! Charge
the guns with grapeshot!

Our gentleman nearly had
his hat knocked off.

May I venture to suggest
lunch to Your Majesty?

I hope I may congratulate
Your Majesty on a victory?

There are only eight
rounds left.

The fortifications
have been taken, Sir.

Go to him and find out
exactly how things are.

Prince Andrei's regiment
was in the reserve.

the regiment lost almost
one third of its men.
Sir, there are no more charges.

Run to the reserves
and bring the boxes!

Sir, order them not
to crowd together!

I love this grass, this earth,
this air...

All of our positions are
in enemy hands.

We cannot dislodge them
for lack of troops.

The men are stampeding,
there is no stopping them.
I have not considered it right

that the troops are
in complete disorder.
How dare you say that to me?

on the left and defeated
on the right flank.
If you have seen amiss, sir,
do not say what you don't know.

that I intend to attack
the enemy tomorrow.

Excellency, the troops are
firmly holding their ground.

The French no longer venture
to attack.

Kaisarov! Write out
the order for tomorrow.

Ride down the line and say
that tomorrow we attack.
That very evening and next day
of the loss of halt the army.

A fresh battle proved
physically impossible.

Not for just that day
and that hour

were this man's mind
and conscience darkened.

On him the responsibility
of what was happening

lay more heavily than on all
the others involved.
Never till the end of his life

or the significance of
his actions

which were too contrary
to goodness and truth,

for him to be able
to grasp their meaning.

He could not disavow
his actions,

lauded as they were
by half the world,
and so he had to repudiate

truth, goodness and all
things human.
by want of food and rest,

whether they should continue
to slaughter one another.

but I don't want
to be part of this!

and the terrible work,
which was done
not by the will of man, went on.

A direct consequence of
the battle of Borodino

was Napoleon's senseless
flight from Moscow,

the destruction of the invalid
army of 500,000

and the downfall of
Napoleonic France

on which at Borodino the hand of
an opponent of stronger spirit

title: Война и мир фильм 3 / War and Peace film 3

comments.text:
Estreia no Porto do filme Guerra e Paz (1966) de Sergey Bondarchuk.Estreia 
mo Coliseu do Porto, Portugal, a 24-10-1969, o primeiro episódio 
(Austerlitz).2º. Episódio, Natasha, estreou a 14-11-1969.3º. Episódio, O 
Incêndio de Moscovo, estreou a 28-11-1969.Os 3 episódios foram apresentados 
em 70 mm.﻿
comments.author: tavares1896

comments.text:
хороший фильм, слов нет. но как историку мне жаль, что историческая 
справедливость объективного освящения событий была принесена в жертву 
идеологии﻿
comments.author: Андрей Жуков

comments.text:
+Андрей Жуков ну если никто не осветил, так откуда же у вас такие 
предположения?
comments.author: Павел Паршев

comments.text: вопросы не только к толстому. разве кто-то другой осветил события по иному?
comments.author: Андрей Жуков

comments.text: +Андрей Жуков Все вопросы к Толстому... =)
comments.author: Павел Паршев

comments.text:
я имел ввиду, что кутузов подставил под разгром наполеону 2-ю армию 
Багратиона. и русская армия понесла чудовищные потери именно из-за того, 
что:
1. во вторую армию было выделено мало артиллерии(200 из более чем 800),
2. боеприпасы не были завезены в достаточном количестве изначально, и не 
подвозились на багратионовы флеши и батарею раевского в ходе боя. в 
результате чего батареи замолчали, прислуга была переколота, батальоны 
прикрытия перебиты.
3. резервы необходимые для контратаки переводились с 
правого(бездействующего) фланга уже во время боя и под фланговым огнем 
противника. а генерал Бененгсен предлагал это сделать еще накануне 
битвы(без потерь).
таким образом, можно говорить, за поражение русской армии в  бородино 
боролись 2 полководца: Наполеон(активно) и кутузов(пассивно). а в фильме 
кутузов показан как провидец, который предугадывает шаги Наполеона.
и еще. в фильме отражен важный исторический момент - в конце первого дня 
битвы кутузов ОБЕЩАЕТ продолжить битву на второй день и разбить французов, 
что нашло горячий отклик как у офицеров, так и у солдат. но ночью нарушает 
свое слово и дает приказ на отступление. почему?
comments.author: Андрей Жуков

comments.text: +Андрей Жуков Вы имеете ввиду соответствие с текстом произведения?
comments.author: Павел Паршев

comments.text:
Помилуйте, милсдарь, и царь на балу не стоял посередине зала аки чучело, 
выставив вперед ногу, и адъютант к Александру подошел не так, как он это 
сделал в романе (право, читайте роман, господа, перед фильмом, поскольку 
идея моря не появится из ванны, хотя вода та же;). К сожалению, потеряно 
чувство соотношения абсолютной власти и ее приближения:" нас там не 
стояло". А Бондарчук все-таки сработал хорошее кино. Царствие небесное и 
земной поклон мастеру.﻿

comments.text:

novel.

Британская империя не стыдится "добровольного присоединения" Гвалиора, Агры 
и проч. раджастанов, и не думает каяться - так нам ли стыдиться за 
Бухарский Эмират? Меочем, мы из Бухары и Хивы продовольствия не выкачивали, 
и при Российской империи голода там не случалось...

comments.text:

воровским отродьем покончено на века.

comments.author: Gerhard Barkhorn

comments.text:
03:45 сейчас в России опять хотят вернуть аристократию, великих мужей науки 
и культуры и прочую псевдоправду. Сегригация общества. Разделение его на 
достойных и холопов. Запомните капиталисты не бывать этому. Сейчас мы 
слабы. Вы бросаете нам кости с вашего стала и народ гниет но помня муки 
революции боиться подняться в полный рост и заявить о себе, но наше время 
придет и мы вырежем вас вместе с вашими семьями. Так что грабя нас, 
помните, что за каждую копейку вернете нам кровью своих детей. :)
comments.author: spacetoxicology123

comments.text:
Ваше заявление спорно, сударь. Я очень уважаю Русскую историю и культуру, 
но позвольте с Вами здесь не согласен я. Вспомните 1979 год. Это конечно не 
Россия, но что-то Российского в этих людях есть.
comments.author: spacetoxicology123

comments.text:
О господи... Туркестан и Бухарский Эмират сам к нам присоединился?

не кому не нужна. Военная компания против России не нужна потому что 
русские сами продают свои "несметные богатсва" за копейки (лес,нефть,газ и 
тд.) Китайцы, США поэтому и не хотят воевать. Им это незачем.

comments.text:
Best wishes from Prague, three days before the Borodino bicentenary. Any 
person truly interested in history and literature will savour this version. 
Some of the interior monologues could perhaps have been omitted or 
shortened. All the same, directing such a monument and playing the leading 
male role appears almost superhuman, and Sergei Bondarchuk remains a titan 
of the world cinematography. Your uploading helps many viewers with their 
time management. JA BLAGODARYU VAS.
comments.author: Pavlína Antošová

comments.text:
Этот шедевр мирового кинематографа в расцвете СССР как великой державы 
переплюнул все голливудские фильмы на то время как по мастерству режиссера, 
так и по игре актеров и по постановке. А наш Мосфильм не может оцифровать и 
отреставрировать это произведение искусства в достойном высоком качестве 
изображения и звука, чтобы каждый эпизод фильма дышал по новому, и чтобы 
каждый современный зритель мог оценить красоту, и атмосферу данного 
кинопроизведения. Надеюсь мы увидим этот шедевр в HD!
